keyword: how many calories in a tuna fish sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Tuna Fish Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a tuna fish sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tuna Fish Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 100 g canned tuna in water (drained), 1 tbsp mayonnaise, diced celery/onion, on 2 slices white bread; no added cheese or veggies.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, bread type, mayo amount, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical tuna fish sandwich contains about 380 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to whole wheat bread (2 slices)

faqs.q: How many calories in a tuna fish sandwich with mayo?
faqs.a: About 380 kcal for a standard version with 1 tbsp mayo.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna fish sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 20 g protein from the tuna and bread.

faqs.q: Are tuna sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to canned tuna and bread; opt for low-sodium tuna to reduce.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a tuna fish sandwich?
faqs.a: Use light mayo, Greek yogurt instead, or more veggies and less tuna for under 300 kcal.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in tuna sandwiches?
faqs.a: White bread adds ~150 kcal for 2 slices; whole grain is similar but offers more fiber.
